key_points: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle honored Martin Luther King Day by providing lunch for The Mission Continues' volunteers.
They expressed their gratitude and recognition of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s legacy in a message.
The couple has previously engaged in community service, including distributing food with The Mission Continues in November.
Lunch for the volunteers was organized by Homegirl Catering, a part of Homeboy Industries.
The pair previously visited Homeboy Industries to help prepare food for the #FeedHOPE program amid the COVID-19 pandemic.
Father Greg Boyle of Homeboy Industries praised Harry and Meghan for their hands-on help and kinship with the workers.
The Mission Continues showed appreciation for the support from Harry, Meghan, and their Archewell Foundation on Instagram.
The food support took place over the holiday weekend, marking the couple's ongoing commitment to community service.
Harry has consistently participated in charity works, including a notable visit to The Mission Continues' base in Compton.
Harry and Meghan signed their message with their names, adding their Duke and Duchess of Sussex titles.
